UPDATE 2-Chevron posts first loss since 2002 on crude oil plunge Jan 29 Chevron Corp reported its first quarterly loss in more than 13 years on Friday despite Wall Street's expectations for a profit, as plunging oil prices eroded profitability across all its divisions. Jan 29 Chevron Corp reported a fourth-quarter loss on Friday as the oil producer grappled with how best to handle plunging crude prices.UPDATE 2-Chevron posts first loss since 2002 on crude oil plunge Jan 29 Chevron Corp reported its first quarterly loss in more than 13 years on Friday despite Wall Street's expectations for a profit, as plunging oil prices eroded profitability across all its divisions.  
CL,Colgate-Palmolive posts 7.6 pct drop in 4th-qtr salesUPDATE 1-Colgate-Palmolive sales miss on strong dollar, weak LatAm demand Jan 29 Colgate-Palmolive Co reported lower-than-expected sales for the last quarter of 2015, hurt by a strong dollar and weak demand in Latin America.  UPDATE 1-Colgate-Palmolive sales miss on strong dollar, weak LatAm demand Jan 29 Colgate-Palmolive Co reported lower-than-expected sales for the last quarter of 2015, hurt by a strong dollar and weak demand in Latin America. Jan 29 Colgate-Palmolive Co, the world's largest toothpaste maker, reported a 7.6 percent fall in quarterly sales as a strong dollar once again trimmed the value of sales from outside the United States and demand weakened in Latin America.UPDATE 1-Colgate-Palmolive sales miss on strong dollar, weak LatAm demand Jan 29 Colgate-Palmolive Co reported lower-than-expected sales for the last quarter of 2015, hurt by a strong dollar and weak demand in Latin America.

HOUSTON Phillips 66  may consider increasing its 25 percent stake in Energy Transfer Partners' pipeline project to move North Dakota Bakken oil to Illinois, but the company's current commitment is where we would like it to be at this point

PG,EU mergers and takeovers (Jan 29) BRUSSELS, Jan 29 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process: 
PVH,Global apparel brands pledge to improve conditions for Bengaluru workers MUMBAI, Jan 29 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Clothing companies H&M;, Inditex, C&A; and PVH have committed to improving the lives of workers in India's southern city of Bengaluru, after a report said employees lived in appalling conditions and were denied decent wages and freedom of movement. 
RTN,More U.S. missile defense improvements to be tested this year WASHINGTON, Jan 29 Boeing Co said on Friday it would test additional improvements to its ground-based U.S. missile defense system later this year during a first test of the system's ability to intercept an intercontinental ballistic missile, or ICBM. 
V,TABLE-Polish banks set for cash and shares from Visa deal - RTRS (Adds PKO BP estimate)     WARSAW, Jan 29 Polish lenders stand to gain cash and Visa Inc shares after the world's largest payments network buys its subsidiary Visa Europe from its local member banks.     Visa said last month it would buy Visa Europe for up to $23.3 billion.      Below is a summary of Polish banks' estimates of how much they expect to receive from the deal, expected to be finalised in the second quarter of 2016:  Lender                  Owner                Cash    
WFC,UPDATE 1-Wells Fargo, BofA look to integrate Apple Pay into ATMs -TechCrunchWells Fargo, BofA look to integrate Apple Pay into ATMs: TechCrunch Wells Fargo & Co and Bank of America Corp are working to integrate mobile payment system Apple Pay into their ATMs, technology news website TechCrunch reported. WHR,Whirlpool quarterly profit more than doublesUPDATE 3-Whirlpool sees North America driving growth in 2016 * Shares rise as much as 5.3 pct   (Adds details from conference call, shares)  UPDATE 3-Whirlpool sees North America driving growth in 2016 * Shares rise as much as 5.3 pct   (Adds details from conference call, shares) Jan 29 Whirlpool Corp said its quarterly profit more than doubled, helped by cost- and capacity-reduction actions and acquisitions.UPDATE 3-Whirlpool sees North America driving growth in 2016 * Shares rise as much as 5.3 pct   (Adds details from conference call, shares)  
XRX,Xerox to split in two; give Icahn three board seats: WSJPrinter maker Xerox to split into twoUPDATE 3-Xerox to split into two companies, Icahn to get board seats on one Jan 29 Xerox Corp will split into two companies, one holding its legacy printer operations and the other its business process outsourcing unit, it said on Friday, in a bid to be more nimble after years of trying to integrate the businesses.  UPDATE 3-Xerox to split into two companies, Icahn to get board seats on one Jan 29 Xerox Corp will split into two companies, one holding its legacy printer operations and the other its business process outsourcing unit, it said on Friday, in a bid to be more nimble after years of trying to integrate the businesses.
